website_summaries.verdict: A well-constructed and comfortable camp chair that is sturdy yet compact.
pros: Users report that the design on this camp chair is excellent – lightweight yet strong enough to handle heavier weights
Mesh netting, which is durable yet breathable and keeps you cool
cons: Some feel the design of the back is too low, and it is a low profile chair so it sits closer to the ground

customer_reviews.title: Worth mentioning...
customer_reviews.text: Worth mentioning: Two drawbacks of the chair is that many times being so low is awkward or impractical - especially when you meet with friends who have the taller chairs - although I personally like sitting on the floor. However, I'll tell you that the one thing I really don't like is that the back does not go high enough to rest your head; I think that is the true reason why it feels awkward to sit "back" on it as if to try and relax for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Cuervo

customer_reviews.title: Sweet little chairs.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I really like these little chairs. They are comfortable and well built. the cloth is thick, rugged, well stitched and trimmed. the feed are well thought out. They do not pack down much smaller than a regular camp chair. I am happy with this purchase. Tested in the Florida Everglades and 10k islands.
customer_reviews.author: BoatCamperTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great chair but heavy
customer_reviews.text: Weighed the chair to see exactly how much it was, 7.2 pounds. 7.2 pounds doesn't seem like a lot until you have 2 of them and are walking down to the beach. 14.4 pounds is heavy when you also have other beach equipment. I love that it folds up vs the square beach chairs but for the weight it's not worth it to me. Other than the weight the chair is made very well, sturdy. Easy to fold and get back into the bag. Very comfortable to sit in and love it for low tide at the beach. Only used once so not sure if it's rusts easy. Will update when if it rusts.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Both broke first night of camping
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these rather than one of the lighter camp chairs because this was supposed to be more durable. Well, it's only as strong as it's weakest piece. I'm 6'1" and 220lbs, gf is 5'9" and 150lbs. We went camping in Zion National Park and it was hot but we only used them at night when the temperature had cooled off. The plastic piece on the back of the chair where the top cross-bar meets the armrest warped on both chairs to the point that both became unusable. You might have better luck in cold weather but I highly recommend staying away from this if you plan on using them in warm weather.
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best Beach/Concert/Camping Chair on Amazon...
customer_reviews.text: Tired of wobbly plastic chairs? Or soccer chairs that break after your third use? 1. Understand that these chairs are very low to the ground. Perfect for the sand beach, or outdoor concert where height is a concern. 2. I am 6'7, 275 lbs and this is a very sturdy, comfortable, and stable chair when used on the beach. I was afraid that it might be too small and uncomfortable, but it's design is excellent and is the most comfortable outdoor chair I have ever had camping. 3. Unfolds, and collapses easily. A good carry bag is provided as well. Material seems to be quality, strong, attractive, and is easy to carry. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Outdoorguy001

customer_reviews.title: Not for taller or heavier people
customer_reviews.text: Great concept, however, poor execution. Anyone over 150 lbs will find that the clips that are supposed to hold it in place slide up into plastic housing and get stuck in there. When they're stuck you can't fold the chair back up. Really have to wrestle it everytime you use it.
customer_reviews.author: Andre G

customer_reviews.title: Solid chair but missing some useability
customer_reviews.text: Things I like: Sturdy and comfortable. Fits easily in the carry bag. Things that could be better: b) It's a little tough to get the metal end parts into the 4 fabric sleeves; b) missed opportunity to provide a small pocket or something on the back of the chair for a phone, glasses, keys etc. I've seen other chairs with this handy feature. The chair is heavy so it is not an easy pack/carry IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Spagooski

customer_reviews.title: Quality equipment
customer_reviews.text: During two commercial trips down the Colorado both outfitters used ALPS chairs and tents so I saw they endure rough use by many first time campers. This chair is reclined enough so I don’t feel the need to lean back and balance on the back legs and low enough to extend my legs without a foot rest. It is great for relaxing/reading but if you want to keep getting up a taller chair would be a better choice. Comes with quality color matched carry bag with adjustable shoulder strap which can be slung around the back of the chair.
customer_reviews.author: HelloViennaCalling

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and comfort
customer_reviews.text: The minute I opened this chair for the first time I could see and feel the quality with which it was built. It is SOLID, and comfy. Perfect for concerts in the park or the beach, when you want to be seated low. I love the chair. Also want to mention, I forgot it was in my driveway, and backed my Jeep Wrangler over it. I heard the crunch and thought for sure I'd be having to replace the chair. No damage - and it still folds and unfolds like normal and sits so comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: My favorite compact chair
customer_reviews.text: I love this little chair! It's easy to carry in one hand, even without the bag, and doesn't take up much space in my Jeep. The quality of the steel frame and sturdy fabric and stitching should keep it around for a long time. The mesh seating area is SO nice these hot summer days. At night I like that the back is high enough to rest my head while looking at the stars. Good khaki outdoor color. I also own their full height chair, and it's a winner too. Note: If you have problems squatting down, getting in and out of these low chairs will be difficult for you.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: This will be perfect for truck camping
customer_reviews.text: I needed a short chair to use inside my truck bed with a topper. It is not tall, so I needed to be closer to the ground, but I didn't want to sit ON the uneven surface of my truck bed. This is nice. It was difficult to fold up after I had sat in it for a while, but I assume that was because it is new and I'm not used to it yet. It is a little heavier and bulkier than I expected, but within reason and I will keep it and use it until I kill it!
customer_reviews.author: JanneZack

customer_reviews.title: Big Nope
customer_reviews.text: This chair doesn't like to fold! Also it unfolds rather too much--to the point that it thinks it's a bed. I took it camping and ended up sitting on a stone bench most of my sitting time, which did not make my backside happy but it was better than lying in my camping chair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All I wanted was a chair
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a outdoor foldable chair... something comfortable for outdoor setting, light weight.. and inexpensive with good built quality.. I think after a few weeks of researching I have narrow it down to this chair... It has everything I have describe.. The funny thing is I found this chair to be so comfortable I have just kept it in the house for indoor use lol! I can literally sit on this chair for literally hours without feeling uncomfortable. I guess the only bad thing about this chair how low it is cause it can be hard to get up once you are use to it.. but that is also a good thing about this chair that makes it so comfortable.

customer_reviews.title: V good family friendly chair 👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: Really love this little chair. Im ok w sitting low to the ground and needed a chair I could share w my almost 5 year old daughter, and this was perfect. It's low and sturdy enough to allow for the perpetual motion of her constant wiggling, getting up, sitting back down, ad infinitum, without any concern it might topple over. It comes w a drawstring carrying bag, and when packed it's an agreeable size and weight to carry along. I'll use this for beach, festivals, camping, and on the porch. I like the design details like the feet and the padded armrests. Wish there were more colors to choose from. :)
customer_reviews.author: Emily C.

customer_reviews.title: nice chair!
customer_reviews.text: This chair was perfect for sitting on the beach with my toes in the water.... I think the only thing missing is a cup holder- something y'all might consider for an update. But I like the color and it is so easy to deal with and very good for lounging. I'm very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: D. Oswald

customer_reviews.title: Great little chair
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Cockapoo. He likes sitting outside with us at the fire and I hate when it gets dirty or the ground is wet. This also keeps him from wondering around too close to the fire. I was trying to find a chair that was low to the ground and sturdy. I also added vinyl to it. I know my dog is spoiled but my kids are grown and he's such a good boy
customer_reviews.author: Sam Jag

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with this camp chair. High quality, durable and comfortable for me. I compared this chair to the REI version: -The exact same frame is used for both chairs. -The material on the ALPS chair is thicker and higher quality whereas the material on the REI chair felt more flimsy and didn't support my upper back as well. -The ALPS chair is at least $10 less expensive. This was an easy choice for me, and I'm very happy with it. As a long-time member of REI (20+ years), I've become more disappointed with their prices and lack of quality of an increasing number of items.
customer_reviews.author: Rcst

customer_reviews.title: these are a good choice. However
customer_reviews.text: Just as described. We had to buy these type of chairs for an outdoor concert that only allowed chairs up to a certain height. Served that purpose, but man, these are hard to get out of and then stand up. Obviously they are low to the ground, so if you want that, these are a good choice. However, no cup holder on this model, so that's a missing convenience feature.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Seat height is perfect
customer_reviews.text: This thing is stupid comfy. Don't be scared by the low height of the seat, it's a god send from Zeus himself. The angle you sit in the chair supports the low height and it's incredibly comfortable to sit in. It's also incredibly easy to back up to wall or anything to rest your head on and fall asleep on. The chair is well made and held up great on my latest training exercise in the wood for 6 days. Pretty much everyone was jealous. Recommended for every outdoor excursion.
customer_reviews.author: Fossil

customer_reviews.title: Short, but Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Nice beach chair, but the arms are of little use. This is a heavy duty unit and I'm confident it will stand up well. This said, my favorite beach/low chairs are the 'Rio Beach' high back chair with actual hard arm rest - they sit low and carry as a backpack. This chair (Alps) is heavy duty, ventilated and a nice chair to watch Soccer or other children's sports. Note: this is a low chair, you sit very close to the ground.
customer_reviews.author: JeffTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Relax....this is a fantastic purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This chair is all it is advertised to be. It is easy to carry due to it's light weight and well crafted carrying bag. It is the perfect size to enjoy all manner of outdoor events and festivities. Mind you, the chair sits LOW. Don't expect to pull up to the picnic table and eat in this chair. Think music festival, beach night, soccer games, etc. and sitting comfortably off the ground, yet low enough not to impede the view of those around you.
customer_reviews.author: SAW

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than I thought when folded up. But awesome!
customer_reviews.text: A great camp chair. I find it to be a more relaxed position. Kind of like having your feet up on a stool. It is however a little larger than I expected when folded up. It’s about the same diameter as most basic chairs, it’s just not as long. But it really is sturdy and comfortable so well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: CerchOne

customer_reviews.title: Good chair.  Good quality.  Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: This chair is exactly what I needed. I bought because its compact enough to take motorcycle camping. Its very good quality.. and extremely comfortable. I was waiting to see it in person before buying a second chair for my daughter for our camping trips. I'll be getting another one asap. Thx.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Strong and durable!
customer_reviews.text: Great strong and sturdy chair. I’m a heavy 230lb man and this has held up very well after several camping trips. I wanted a chair that would not fall apart or break the cheap plastic joints but this one has proven itself to be durable and can hold my weight getting in and out of it. This is a short/low chair perfect for campfires and packing around.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Grizzle

customer_reviews.title: Low profile chair.
customer_reviews.text: Ok this is a great small camping chair. It's low profile makes it lite and easy to stow. It's well made and comes in a carry bag. It's as comfortable as any camp chair. My only issue is the back of my chair has to reput on the chair post every time chair is opened and closed. Which I have not had to do on other camping type chairs. Not a huge deal but annoying if you had open/ close it multiple times during a day. Overall I do light this chair and would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Martini81

customer_reviews.title: Over priced, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I found these to be too low to the ground. I am only 5'3" and weigh 110lbs and I could feel my bottom touch the ground when I sat in it. Also, my husband is 6' and 185 lbs. , well within the recommended weight limit yet his chair broke on our first camping trip. We returned the chairs when we got back.
customer_reviews.author: Travel Light

customer_reviews.title: Super low and not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: This chair is extremely low and is hard to get out of. We originally purchased two for an RV trip and quickly found out that these are only suitable for the beach or concerts where low chairs are desirable or required. We prefer chairs that are between the two extremes in terms of height, and these are not those. The chair is sturdy and well designed though. If you want to sit as close to the ground as possible these are for you!
customer_reviews.author: Bluezhawg

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my orange folding chair
customer_reviews.text: Love this sturdy folding chair with carry pouch and shoulder strap. Color makes it easy to find or tell others to stay in their black or grey seats. Level is low which I like so I can set my drink in the ground instead of jacking up my wrist w a useless cup holder. So fond of this chair.
customer_reviews.author: pen lilac

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC CHAIRS. My husband is 6'6 and 260 pounds ...
customer_reviews.text: FANTASTIC CHAIRS. My husband is 6'6 and 260 pounds and he sits comfy on these chair which was my biggest concern!
customer_reviews.author: JEANETTE

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth It....
customer_reviews.text: The folding mechanism on this chair is poorly designed and fails easily. If you're 140 lbs it may be ok but anything past that weight and it will buckle. I like the chairs I just wish the manufacturer cared about designing a quality product. It's truly sad.
customer_reviews.author: PAB182

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and not hard to get out of!
customer_reviews.text: I love this chair. It fits nicely on my motorcycle, is small and light enough. Wonderfully comfortable, and does not pinch on the bottom of my thighs. A bit awkward to get into, since it is so low to the ground, but not as hard to get out of. (I’m 40, so still have decently working knees. YMMV) Very, very, very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Tibor Moldovan

customer_reviews.title: A must have if you're sitting outdoors!
customer_reviews.text: The reviews on this are accurate! This chair is super compact and very comfortable. I bought it to take to an outdoor concert that had a height limit on chairs for viewing purposes. Worked great, plenty of room, very comfortable. Im about 5'8" and 215 lbs, this chair didnt even flinch. Will definitely be buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable chairs that are low profile.
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are very comfortable. I bought two to take to the beach with me. They are great for sitting at the beach or around a campfire. They are low profile though so it is difficult to sit down in them whilst holding a plate of food and beverage. I have had friends ask where I got them and everyone who has sat in them has seemed to had a favorable experience. I have been considering buying two more for social gatherings.
customer_reviews.author: PyroSwardsman

customer_reviews.title: Makes me look...oops, feel sexy!
customer_reviews.text: I'm thinking I should order four more for my living room. 30 years ago I would've. Seriously, this chair is very comfortable! Yes it's low...but the back has good height (I'm 5' 11") to lean back in. The seat cradles my bum well. The khaki color is a shade darker than expected, but that's just fine with me. The chair looks great whether I'm sitting in it or not.
customer_reviews.author: Tab

customer_reviews.title: Great portable chair
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had many backpacking chairs and portable chairs. This is one of the best I’ve had. I’m +200lb and it’s sturdy and very comfortable. Sitting around the camp fire caused no fatigue on my back at all. It’s low to the ground so getting out can be a challenge if you relax too long. :). Fairly lightweight and very portable. Not really small enough for backpacking. I have two and highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: BC59

customer_reviews.title: Used in military. Tough and Comfortable. Would Give 6 stars if I could
customer_reviews.text: Used this thing for years in the military in full kit. Between various people on the gunline, we'd plop down into this and none of the stitching or frame broke. Only thing that started to give way was the little cushioning around the handles, but I wrapped that with tape and it was fine. Gave it to a buddy when I got out and moved back across the country and bought myself another. Would give 6 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K

customer_reviews.title: great at the beach
customer_reviews.text: great chair. i used this at the beach all summer. sturdy and comfortable. light weight & low profile make it perfect for the beach. easier to carry and more comfortable than the taller folding chairs. i like that i can sit with my legs stretched straight out. the only drawback is that it can sometimes be hard to get out of the chair as it sinks into the sand while you're trying to stand up.
customer_reviews.author: siggy

customer_reviews.title: Great little chair.
customer_reviews.text: Strong and comfortable. I'm 250 lbs., and this chair holds me up with no problem. I'm using at the river. It's perfect for sitting at the river's edge and keeping my feet wet. I'm over 55 and I do not have a problem getting out of this chair as some of the other folks have complained. It's perfect for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Eric G.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality. Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Took it for the first time finally after my original trip was cancelled. It lasted a whole night before the pieces deformed and the chair stopped working. Now it sits flat instead of as a chair. I’m 155 lbs so I don’t know why I caused this to fail, maybe the sun? But aren’t these made for outdoors?
customer_reviews.author: BdReader

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Chair
customer_reviews.text: I love these chairs I have used them for years when I go on kayaking trips. I really prefer being low to the ground. That being said... if you have a hard time getting out of low chairs, this is not the chair for you. These chairs are quality and last forever. I just needed to purchase an additional one for my collection.
customer_reviews.author: Lyshk

customer_reviews.title: Awesome chairs that did not disappoint
customer_reviews.text: I love this camping chair. I prefer being low to the ground when hanging out around camp b/c you don't need to find something to kick your feet up on. I bought two for using at the beach and around campfires and they are great. I'm 6'2" and 250lbs and these chairs have no problem supporting me. I compared this chair to one of REI's offerings. And while I am a big fan of REI in general, this chair was less expensive and looked just as good.
customer_reviews.author: J. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable low position with good back support and plenty of seat room.
customer_reviews.text: I love the sturdiness and comfort. Really well made and easy to set up - just pull. It's not one of the light weight models, but it's not too much to swing over your shoulder with a couple of other bags and a child on your shoulders. Just what I wanted. I tried two others (especially the light weight ones) but the seating position didn't suit me.
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: 100% missed the point of beach chair
customer_reviews.text: 100% Missed the point of Beach Chair- Heavy & bulky - yes it’s comfortable, but it is made for RV travel not walking down the beach with an 8.5 lb anchor over the shoulder. Twice the weight it should be. Dragged this thing to Cape Cod trip, not happening again.
customer_reviews.author: Ed of VT

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and comfortable chairs
customer_reviews.text: I bought these chairs to meet the local concert venue chair-height restriction requirement. I am glad the chair height is exactly as the specifications. The red fabric and grey mesh and stylish, and the chairs are sturdy. We could sit in the chair for hours without being fatigued. The chair frames are steel, not aluminum, so the chair is not exactly light to carry around. Luckily the carry bag is sturdy and the shoulder strap is comfortable, so it's not a hardship to carry this thing for an hour or so. Love it, and would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mtroberts99

customer_reviews.title: Great low profile seats for outdoor grass area at a concert!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these low profile chairs to use at an outdoor concert. They are very comfortable and seem to be very sturdy. The only issue we had was when it came to folding it back up. I think we need to practice a few time to find the right way to fold it up more easily. Once we did get it folded up it was quite easy to slide it’s cover bag over it to then carry (shoulder strap.) Really light weight. Very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jeep Gal CO

customer_reviews.title: works great for kids.
customer_reviews.text: We actually got this for my 1 year old daughter. It's both her camping chair as well as her living room chair. I got this so I wouldn't be too woried about her falling out of it (most kids chairs are remakibly tall), she could get in and out on her own, it could fold up when not in use, it could wash off with a hose, and she could grow with it (will still fit her as a teenager/adult). Best purchase I've made for my daughter, she uses it all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin G. Hess

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, compact chair
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. The chair is very easy to unfold and very comfortable. Low to the ground (which I wanted) it can be easily stored in a matching bag that has a comfortable, wide and adjustable (length) shoulder strap.
customer_reviews.author: Cecile

customer_reviews.title: So close
customer_reviews.text: I really like the low slung design and at first it is quite comfortable. However, there is a crossbar on the front of the chair that ends up becoming a pressure point on the back of your legs, making it very uncomfortable. I'm 6'2" and weigh 180 lb for reference. Major enough if a flaw that I would not recommend this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Matt P

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor concerts
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are great! We purchased two of them to take to the Gorge Amphitheater for lawn seating. The amphitheater doesn't allow anything higher than 9 inches from the ground so we couldn't bring normal lawn chairs. The lawn section is also quite steep. These chairs are reclined back enough that we weren't leaning forward. They are very comfortable and not too heavy. I read some reviews about feeling the crossbar, so I bought self inflating Teton cushions, but didn't have to use them. I would recommend them to anyone and will probably buy two more
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable camp chair, welcome at the end of a day
customer_reviews.text: I took this chair on a cross-USA motorcycle trip, and while it takes up it's share of space (it is pretty long folded up), it was really welcomed at the end of a long day of riding since it provides nice upper back support. It is sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: harryhendo

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor concerts
customer_reviews.text: Perfect chair for outdoor concerts. I bought this to take to a concert at Riverbend because they have a maximum chair height requirement and this is exactly what I was looking for. Very strong and sturdy. A lot more comfortable than I thought it would be. The only thing it is missing, is a cup holder. Great quality item at a great price
customer_reviews.author: TAK1979

customer_reviews.title: for the kids to sit comfortably in the middle
customer_reviews.text: we use these to put in our big 20 foot canoe, for the kids to sit comfortably in the middle, but still keep a low center of gravity so we don't tip. they work marvelously, and their construction is solid--so much better than the similar models we have found at our local outdoor stores (if we find them at all there). The pivot points and joints where the frame joins are well built.
customer_reviews.author: jobew

customer_reviews.title: It's really a great chair, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It's really a great chair, especially for the price. Far better construction and more durable than expected. And actually, and really surprisingly, comfortable! Bought a couple for outdoor concerts, and nicely lowbacked. Also used camping, put at the banks of a river and streched our feet into the water, the steel makes me not worry about rust. I was worried about ease of getting into and out of the chair and it again surprised me, the angle of the armrests makes it stable for getting out without falling to the ground. I can definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: M. Sbot

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, good so far
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used these very much yet, but next concert season these will get a ton of use. A little heavy, as expected, but I wanted them to be strong enough to handle moderate abuse. Wish they had a cupholder of some sort. If they last and IF they had a cupholder, would be 5 stars. Can't speak to durability yet, but so far they have held up fine to light use in the backyard.
customer_reviews.author: TJ C

customer_reviews.title: Great company normally, questionable chair
customer_reviews.text: While I can't/won't argue that the chair is well made, it's so low to the ground that you can only kick out your legs and leave them lay there like you have no intention of getting up. This leaves you susceptible to campfire smoke in the face and being at crotch level to all of your friends that have normal height chairs. The bar in the front gets uncomfortable after awhile too.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic D

customer_reviews.title: Really Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for an outdoor play and concert. They are the perfect height. I took my mom to the play. She is a much larger women and usually doesn't like folding chairs because they are uncomfortable and pinch her sides. The arms on these are great and she (for the first time I can remember in 30 years) was actually comfortable sitting in it for over 4 hours. I think she's going to end up stealing one of them for herself.
customer_reviews.author: Chynna Tipton

customer_reviews.title: ALPS Low Profile Folding Camp Chair from Amazon.com Services
customer_reviews.text: ALPS Low Profile Folding Camp Chair from Amazon.com Services. Nice low profile chair. Very comfortable once you are seated. Getting on and off of it can be problematic for some folks. Listed as a “camping” chair. Not sure this type folding mechanism would fair well in sand.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Return Return......parts snapped off first use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for a car show weekend I selected these because they were going to be available by the time we were leaving for the weekend. Tested them when they arrived and they were perfect. Fast forward to the first day that we used them both (purchased 2) had parts snap off good thing we still had back up chairs. The parts that broke off are part of the backing to the arm rest.
customer_reviews.author: Waasabi Girl Designs

customer_reviews.title: Comfy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for a day at the beach over 4th of July weekend. One chair had a mind of its own and was hard to fold back. Wasn't able to be bothered with it at the time. When I woke up in the morning I tackled this chair problem. Got it back. The plastic rings on the shaft were the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Falsesteak

customer_reviews.title: Decent chair.
customer_reviews.text: Seems overpriced for a beach chair and not as comfortable as I would like, but it’s a nice looking solid chair. Good for a plus size person but just barely....actually wish it was a bit wider.
customer_reviews.author: Chili Charli

customer_reviews.title: Great chair
customer_reviews.text: Chair sits really low to the ground so if you have knee issues you probably should avoid. It works great for concerts in the park and fishing. It is sturdy and large. I love it, my husband wants one.
customer_reviews.author: Moni4u2nv

customer_reviews.title: Great chair - very sturdy and looks good
customer_reviews.text: Great chair - very sturdy and looks good. I bought this for a motorcycle camping trip - shorter legs equal easier packing. The only problem, and this isn't the chair's fault but more physics - I'm a big guy, 6'2'' and about 250. It's not easy getting in and out of this bad boy. Long way down and not much leverage to get out easily.
customer_reviews.author: On Wisconsin!

customer_reviews.title: A must have for outdoor concert-goers!
customer_reviews.text: Great low profile chair. Great for outdoor concerts, many amphitheaters dont allow regular sized chairs to be brought in, however you dont have that problem with this low profile chair.
customer_reviews.author: G. Scott Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Low to the Ground Chair
customer_reviews.text: Great low to the ground outdoor portable chair. I tad bit heavy to haul long distances(carrying case strap not padded)...but otherwise it is a workhorse of a chair...great to take anyplace you want to sit low to the ground.
customer_reviews.author: jules

customer_reviews.title: nice and compact
customer_reviews.text: good alternative to the traditional folding camp chair. If your shoulders are a bit broader and not beta then you will be nice and comfortable in this chair unlike the others like the Coleman camp chairs.
customer_reviews.author: D. Yang

customer_reviews.title: Not compact but comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed and comfortable. Some things to consider: its size is somewhere between a full size folding chair and a compact chair. It also sits very low to the ground. But comfortable once you are in it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair for "full grown" people
customer_reviews.text: I am 6'6" and 300 lbs. It is difficult for me to find light weight camping chairs that can hold me long term. These do the trick and are very comfortable. If you are on the taller side, you will not be able to sit in a way that you neck or head are supported, but the chair is more than comfortable enough to make up for lower back. The pivoting feet also make it easier to have a stable base under you regardless of if the ground is flat and they also have a wide enough foot to avoid sinking into the dirt (even with someone as heavy as me in the chair).
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well-made, comfortable - just not a light backpacking chair
customer_reviews.text: This is a VERY STURDY chair but also a very comfortable chair. It is not a light backpacking chair, so dont buy it for that purpose. but if you need a low chair that will last, this chair will do the trick. I didn't want to buy one of the off-brands on here and am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the kayak, perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: So I like to sit low at beaches with a book and my feet all up in the sand (tough life, I know), but the basic low seat beach chair is a fold up, and when attached to the back of my kayak turns into a sail! Not this one, has a bag and folds up like a camping or tailgating chair. Love the burnt orange color too. Perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Jopom

customer_reviews.title: Good comfortable chair
customer_reviews.text: We ordered these chairs for a concert at avenue that has chair height restrictions. These chairs are perfect!! We had a 3 day festival and never once was uncomfortable in these chairs. Easy to get in and out of. Comes with a bag for easy carrying. We will definately use these chairs often for a variety of things!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy construction and material.
customer_reviews.text: I have used it several times for hunting. Sturdy construction and material, and the low seat offers superb stability. It can be kind of heavy after awhile for my use and the carrying strap on is a little short so you can only carry with it slung over your shoulder. It would be nicer if the strap was longer to sling across your body which would be great if you plan to walk long distances with it as I do.
customer_reviews.author: an h. tran

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite camp chair
customer_reviews.text: Love this chair! We have a few beach and camp chairs, but they took up too much room for a 3 week road/camping trip I took to Utah. This chair folded up nicely and stored easily. I used it every night for 3+ weeks. It's sturdy and easy to open and close. The low profile means its great for sitting in small tents - it fits very nicely in a sun shade tent I used.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Jensen

customer_reviews.title: great folding chair
customer_reviews.text: This is really great camp chair for the beach or whatever. The mesh back makes it great for drying out after coming out of the water. I originally bought this as a replacement a seat in Hobie Outback kayak. In that role it does not fit, but hey it was worth a shot. That being said though this is a great chair to sit near the water.
customer_reviews.author: Reid E. Smith III

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take to a concert with chair height restrictions. This chair was very comfortable. I sat in it for over 4 hours. I'm a bigger person (actually a little bigger than the weight capacity) and did not feel too big for the chair or like there was a chance it wasn't going to hold me either.
customer_reviews.author: ME

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE these chairs
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these chairs! I bought a pair mostly for using at outdoor picnicking events. Extremely comfortable to sit and stretch my legs out. You can sit up straight, or scrunch down a little to rest your head back and take a nap. For me the height was a selling feature, but I imagine it would be more challenging for people with bad knees since it is pretty low to the ground. Super convenient to be able to fold up and tote in the carrying case. My friends bought chairs that fold up like a traditional folding chair - they are much bulkier and harder to transport.
customer_reviews.author: deal hunter

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these chairs to replace a similar chair from REI, the fabric of which had worn out after a few years. These weren't as comfortable but seemed more sturdy so I kept them Shortly after the return window expired, the fabric frayed at the front seat support so now I have less comfortable chairs that are also falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Alyssum

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CHAIR, STURDY
customer_reviews.text: EXTREMELY well made, sturdy, even for the 'bigger' person. Even though the correct carrying weight is listed, it is still surprisingly fairly heavy -- but of course that means it will hold up to a heavy person sitting in it with long-term use. Worth the weight to me because of the high quality. Reminder, if you have a bad back or knees, it can be difficult to get out of. Worth a carry to the beach! I really like mine and will have it for years!
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor concerts
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this chair to use at outdoor concerts with height restrictions. It's perfect. My only complaint is, I wish the strap on the carrying bag was longer so I could sling it over my head for hands free carrying. As it is now, it's so short it just slips off the shoulder so I'm constantly fixing it. I will invent a way to make it longer.
customer_reviews.author: Doombious

customer_reviews.title: Quality and overall durability was impressive
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price! Used on a recent beach trip. Quality and overall durability was impressive for the price. It did not sink in the dry sand...it would slightly sink when placed on the waters edge/in the water. For such a low sitting chair I found it easy to get in and out of...perfect height for a beach chair!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Gianelloni

customer_reviews.title: Fits in my checked luggage!
customer_reviews.text: This chair is the best. I bought it specifically for a solo beach trip, and wanted to have a chair to use. I measured my suitcase and determined I could fit it in my checked bag, and it worked! Comes with a simple carrying bag and is very fast to open and assemble. It sits low to the ground and is really quite comfortable. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Silv

customer_reviews.title: I found it very comfortable and I'm very pleased with my purchase The only ...
customer_reviews.text: Used for the first time this past week on a trip to the Gulf with my grandchildren. I found it very comfortable and I'm very pleased with my purchase. Appears to be well built. The only thing missing is a couple holder, but hey, I was at the beach and of course this sits low. I just made a little hole and put my cup in the sand!
customer_reviews.author: N. Mininger

customer_reviews.title: Love this chair
customer_reviews.text: I’m very happy with the purchase of this chair, it’s much nicer than a traditional, loudly colored, patterned beach chair. I love the mesh panel.
customer_reviews.author: blkbrrry

customer_reviews.title: very convenient and well made chair
customer_reviews.text: i was looking to get a chair i can travel with and that is very portable.i was pleasantly surprised how portable yet solidly built this chair is.it seems very well made and sturdy.it is also very easy to unfold and fold back into its carrying case.highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Luc Mena

customer_reviews.title: Great portable chair
customer_reviews.text: Chair is low as expected but fit in my suitcase for a music festival i was attending. With practice i learned to get out of the seat more gracefully. It is sturdy and confortable and not too heavy. The width is great too.
customer_reviews.author: Ray E. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking chair doubt it last long for anyone if all crafted the same way
customer_reviews.text: Sat in chair and it laid all the way back.... the supports that hold the metal stoppers are plastic and the metal stoppers slid right through.... I wanted this chair for this week, I may have to see if I can fix it or return if further inspection doesn’t seem promising.....disappointing
customer_reviews.author: TAG

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: This guy has been around about ten campfires and bonfires and on the beach about five times and so far it's been great. I'm about 220 pounds but handle it perfectly well, so I'm careful not to 'fall' into it. It seems sturdy enough and is very comfortable. I wouldn't mind a cup holder somewhere or a pouch, but it is designed to be simple. If you have trouble getting up from low places, don't get this. Otherwise, I would highly recommend it. The included carry bag is just as solid as the product itself. Once again, I love my Alps Mountaineering gear!
customer_reviews.author: Ben, Your Friendly Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: "Clark, This here looks like a quality item"
customer_reviews.text: This chair has a sturdy frame, is lightweight, and seems durable. I like the small size when folded. It's easy to throw over my shoulder and carry where I need to go; and it takes up little space in the back of my car. I noticed some questions on ground clearance; when seated, your derriere will be approximately 3 inches from the ground.
customer_reviews.author: this old house

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Lawn Chair for Concerts
customer_reviews.text: Needed a chair for grass seats at a concert venue that had strict lawn chair regulations. The seat of the chair could be no more than 12" from the ground and the back of the chair could be no higher than 32" than from the ground. This Chair fit the bill and is super comfy. It's my go to concert chair now.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Not a Bad Chair
customer_reviews.text: I liked all aspects of this chair except for its weight. For a folding chair that is meant to be carried I felt it was too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Innes

customer_reviews.title: TOTAL JUNK and No returns
customer_reviews.text: TOTAL Junk. Already broke and no return allowed. We only sat on them about 5 times. not a good product and watch out for the no warranty policy
customer_reviews.author: REC

customer_reviews.title: Good look, cheap construction
customer_reviews.text: The chair looks nice. The fabric held up after one weekend’s use. The construction is mediocre at best. The brackets holding the chair together did not align very well. The chair’s metal part bent extending the chair to the point of where it wouldn’t close very well and extended past the point of comfortable when in extended seated position.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Watson

customer_reviews.title: Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this as house furniture and honestly, it surpasses other lawn furniture (I am cheap!) but I was tired of having my back hurt with other chairs like this one. This one is very comfortable however it is very low to the ground. If you have any issues with getting up or getting down, this would be a bad chair for you. Otherwise, it'd be perfect for a park or hanging out outside! I used this on a wood floor inside and is slides all over! So you might want little grippies on the feet if you put this on tile or anything slick.
customer_reviews.author: RayChu

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly comfortable, close to the ground
customer_reviews.text: When I first pulled this out on a recent camping trip, everyone laughed at it. "Are you sure you got an adult sized chair?" they said. By the end of the trip, it was the favored chair. Incredibly comfortable, close to the ground, and when we went to the river I was able to sit in the water. I will be using this chair for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Sleiman

customer_reviews.title: My husband likes it
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought for himself. He loves it. I’ve had my back fused and it’s really hard for me to get in and out of it.
customer_reviews.author: tattooedfreak

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but.......
customer_reviews.text: I do like how light they are to carry, but after ONE use at the beach, it already shows rusting. I did wash it down after using them and let them dry out in the sun before putting them back in the bag, but still, they rusted.
customer_reviews.author: C.C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy-Folding, Low-Sitting, Comfy Chairs!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these chairs for the beach, and they were PERFECT! They sit low to the ground, so they're great for folks who like to sit near the ocean and let the waves wash up over their legs! The mesh back allows the breeze through, which is also nice. The chairs fold up easily to be pretty compact, and come with a handy little canvas case.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Inez

customer_reviews.title: love it.
customer_reviews.text: wanted something nice and low so i could stretch out my legs while lounging around in my yard. it's perfect for that
customer_reviews.author: cactus

customer_reviews.title: Keep you above the ants and spiders.
customer_reviews.text: Spending more time outside thanks to this great little chair. Seems to be holding up well to lots of immediate use.
customer_reviews.author: IA

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This a pretty cool chair. It’s comfortable, sturdy and fold easily when it’s time to go. I’m sitting on it right now in our living room so I can be near our puppy. I am a little scared that my husband is going to steal it and I’ll have to order another one....he’s eyeballing it. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Terri Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable chair and well made
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable chair and well made. The mesh seat is nice on the beach because it allows the air to get to you. The chair was easy to carry, not too heavy. This chair sits well in the sand and is very comfortable. The only problem that I had with this chair was the fact that I every time I would get up to do something, I would have to chase my family members off my chair when I would come back! I told them to order one for themselves! Seriously, great chair.
customer_reviews.author: Amy D. Sward

product_meta.title: ALPS Mountaineering Rendezvous Chair
product_meta.description: The Alps Rendezvous chair is a great chair for going to the beach or sitting around a campfire. This low-profile chair provides hours of comfort and strength you want in a chair. The Rendezvous allows you to lean back at the perfect angle to relax and stretch your legs. When you are done relaxing, the chair simples collapses and fits into the included carry bag making transporting and storing the chair extremely easy.
feature_bullets: Sturdy powder-coated steel frame and TechMesh Fabric offers you ultimate stability and breathable comfort
Sits low to the ground and allows you to lean back at a perfect angle to relax and stretch out your legs
Conveniently collapses and fits into the included shoulder carry bag so transporting and storing is easy
Perfect chair for beach trips, gathering around the campfire, outdoor concerts or sporting events; options are endless
Dimensions: 22" W x 14" D x 24" H, Weight: 6. 8 lbs. Weight Capacity: 300 lbs. , Color: Khaki

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
